meanings.definition: A closed plane figure with three straight sides and three angles.
meanings.sent1: I drew a triangle on my math homework.
meanings.sent2: The flag had a triangle shape on it.
meanings.sent3: The pizza slice was shaped like a triangle, but it was so big it looked like a sailboat!
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was like a triangle, with each side representing a different aspect of their relationship.
meanings.sent5: The triangle symbolizes strength and stability in many cultures.

meanings.definition: A musical instrument consisting of a steel rod bent into a triangle, open at one corner, that is struck with a metal rod to produce a ringing sound.
meanings.sent1: The percussionist played the triangle during the orchestra performance.
meanings.sent2: The sound of the triangle added a magical touch to the music.
meanings.sent3: When the magician pulled out a giant triangle instead of a wand, the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The triangle's chime echoed through the concert hall, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: The triangle's clear tone cut through the melody, creating a mesmerizing effect.
